awd_titl_txt: Chemoenzymatic Synthesis of Sugar Phosphates, Disaccharides,and Oligosaccharides
awd_abstract_narration: This award is made as the starter grant increment of Dr.                        Chenault's Postdoctoral Fellowship in Chemistry Award in                        support of his research at the University of Delaware. The                      thrust of Dr. Chenault's research is the chemoenzymatic                         synthesis of sugar phosphates, disaccharides and                                oligosaccharides.                                                                                                                                               New strategies will be developed for the regio- and                             stereoselective formation of glycosides.  Phosphorylated                        sugars, both natural and unnatural, will be prepared as target                  molecules, as precursors to oligosaccharides, and as part of                    phosphorylated oligosaccharides having new biological and                       physicochemical properties. In principle, enzymatic methods are                 ideally suited to the regio- and stereoselective manipulation                   of minimally protected saccharides.  Once the synthetic                         methodology is established, the chemistry of the derived                        compounds as biomechanistic, diagnostic and therapeutic tools                   will be explored.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
